poem.line3: It bled, it bled, it bled, it bled.

translation: Su brazo sangró mucho. Su brazo sangró. sangró, sangró, sangró, sangró. Y al final, el piso estaba rojo.

poem.line3: baby. She fed him.  She fed
poem.line4: him.  She fed him until he

poem.line2: No, we met in the ZOO!
poem.line3: No, we met in the PARK!
poem.line4: I know! We met in the zoo in the PARK!
poem.line5: You are right!  Near the monkeys!

poem.line1: The cat slept on the bed.
poem.line2: The cat slept on the books.
poem.line3: Then it slept on the floor.
poem.line4: And in the end, it slept some more!

poem.line6: Then she swept the living room.
poem.line7: And in the end, she swept them

poem.line1: The burglar crept into the office.  (A burglar steals quietly.)
poem.line3: He crept quietly down the HALL.
poem.line4: He crept quietly to the safe!
poem.line6: He crept ALL around the house
poem.line7: and in the end, he stepped on a mouse!

poem.line2: He kept talking, he kept talking.

poem.line1: To weep is to cry a lot.
poem.line2: He wept and wept and wept and wept,
poem.line3: and in the end the floor was wet.

poem.line1: The man knelt.  He knelt and knelt

poem.line3: She felt sad, she felt sad,
poem.line4: but in the end,she felt GLAD.

poem.line1: She left her husband on Tuesday.  She left on WEDNESDAY.
poem.line2: She left on THURSDAY.  But when she REALLY left on FRIDAY,
poem.line3: no one BELIEVED it was TRUE!
poem.line4: And when she wasn't mad, she came back!

poem.line2: He led the STATE.  He led the state.
poem.line3: He led the state and in the end,

poem.line4: she got a job in Las Vegas.

poem.line2: She read and read and read and read,
poem.line3: and in the end, her eyes were red.
They ate and ate and ate and ate,
poem.line5: they fell ASLEEP on their PLATES!

translation: Comieron pavo, puré de patatas y pastel de CALABAZA. Comieron, comieron, comieron y comieron, y al final, ¡se quedaron DORMIDOS en sus PLATOS!

poem:
They ate turkey,
 mashed potatoes and PUMPKIN pie.
 They ate and ate and ate and ate, 
 and in the end, 
they fell ASLEEP on their PLATES!
translation: Comieron pavo, puré de patatas y pastel de CALABAZA. Comieron, comieron, comieron y comieron, y al final, ¡se quedaron DORMIDOS en sus PLATOS!
